title: Sketchbook Folio, "The Pride of Romulus: The Mocking of the Old Captain of the Veii; Two Studies after Carracci", 1821–22
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white heavy wove paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at center left: Lodovico Caracci Bologna; at lower left: 42 Lodovico Caraci Bologna
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Upper drawing of groups of men in classical armor with city and walled temple in background. Lower drawing of figure in bloused tunic playing long pipes, pointing right. Group of figures at left includs older man with long cloak and turban, soldiers and bound figure. Part of temple visible in background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sketchbook Folio, "The Pride of Romulus: The Mocking of the Old Captain of the Veii; Two Studies after Carracci", 1821–22.
1821–22. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white heavy wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3580.
